headline: ‘Vertical integration to the dirt in the ground’: Invinity hunts flow battery supply chain, manufacturing advantage
summary_80w: ESN Premium speaks to Matt Harper, president of flow battery company Invinity Energy Systems, about pursuing a competitive advantage in an emerging space.

headline: Tesla issues Powerwall 2 product recall in Australia following cases of fires
summary_80w: Tesla has issued a product recall on its Powerwall 2 residential battery storage solution across Australia due to a “battery cell defect” from a third-party supplier.

headline: South Korea: ‘Companies have no model to recover their investment in DC energy storage’
summary_80w: Chang Jae Won of the Korea Smart Grid Association believes companies lack a model for recovering their investment in DC energy storage.

headline: Advanced compressed air energy storage: Hydrostor secures US$55 million for 1.6GWh Australia project
summary_80w: Hydrostor has secured US$55 million in funding from Export Development Canada (EDC) to advance development activities for its 200MW/1,600MWh Silver City Energy Storage Centre project in Broken Hill, New South Wales, Australia.

headline: Longroad reaches financial close for 400MW Texas solar project
summary_80w: US renewables developer Longroad Energy has reached financial close for its 400MW 1000 Mile solar project in the US state of Texas.

headline: Self-consumption keeps falling in Spain, sector adds 611MW in H1 2025
summary_80w: For the third year in a row, self-consumption installs have fallen in Spain, with 611MW of new additions in the first half of 2025, according to a report from trade body APPA Renovables.

headline: Trina Solar sees 1GWh BESS fast-tracked in Australia’s Victoria
summary_80w: Chinese PV module manufacturer Trina Solar has received the green light from the Victoria government in Australia to build a 500MW/1,000MWh battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: Acciona Energia commissions 412MWp PV plant in India
summary_80w: Spanish renewables developer and operator Acciona Energía has commissioned its 412MWp Juna solar PV plant in Kawani village in the western state of Rajasthan.

headline: Velto acquires 260MW operational solar portfolio in Spain
summary_80w: Spanish IPP Velto Renewables has acquired a portfolio of 53 operational solar assets in Spain with a combined capacity of 260MW.

headline: Meyer Burger unlikely to survive under provisional debt moratorium
summary_80w: Struggling Swiss solar manufacturer Meyer Burger has formally entered into a debt moratorium, with the possibility of rescuing the entire group now looking unlikely.

headline: Nexamp secures US$350 million financing from Macquarie
summary_80w: Nexamp has secured US$350 million through a long-term financing facility to expand its 6GW utility-scale solar and battery storage pipeline in the US.

headline: DAS Solar plans 5GW XBC cell plant as technology shifts to TOPCon/back contact combination
summary_80w: Chinese module producer DAS Solar is planning a 5GW manufacturing facility focused on producing high-efficiency back contact cells.

headline: California passes bills to reduce energy prices, ‘applauded’ by SEIA and CEBA
summary_80w: The California State Legislature has passed two bills that aim to reduce energy prices in the state, AB 825 and SB 302.

headline: QatarEnergy, Samsung C&T ink EPC contract for 2GW solar PV project in Qatar
summary_80w: QatarEnergy has signed an EPC agreement with Samsung C&T for its 2GW Dukhan project.

headline: Time for US solar to take off the training wheels
summary_80w: PV CellTech: Martin Pochtaruk, CEO of North American solar module manufacturer Heliene, says US producers must learn to survive without tax incentives.

headline: Samsung SDI to start US BESS manufacturing from 2026
summary_80w: South Korean battery and electronics materials manufacturer Samsung SDI debuted its new battery energy storage system (BESS) products at the RE+ trade show in Las Vegas, US.

headline: Arkansas utility seeks approval of 1.4GWh hybrid BESS, with financial support from Google as part of data centre deal
summary_80w: Investor-owned utility (IOU) Entergy is seeking regulatory approval from the Arkansas Public Service Commission (PSC) to construct what could become the largest BESS in the southern US State. It will support a data centre from Google.

headline: Sympower and Suena raise combined €27 million for European BESS optimisation, international expansion
summary_80w: Europe-based BESS optimisation and flexibility providers Sympower and Suena have completed Series B1 and A fundraisings respectively.

headline: China aims for energy storage installations equivalent to today’s global capacity by 2027
summary_80w: China has published a national plan to promote large-scale energy storage facilities, encouraging investment and broader participation in the electricity market.

headline: Over 15GWh of energy storage successful in Australia’s Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 3
summary_80w: Australia's Capacity Investment Scheme (CIS) has awarded 4.13GW/15.37GWh of battery storage capacity in its third tender round, exceeding initial targets and attracting 135GWh of bids.

headline: RE+ 2025: US solar industry calls for resilience amid policy challenges
summary_80w: At RE+, industry leaders pointed to the resilience of the US solar sector, despite challenges brought by the 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' Act.

headline: European solar leaders ask EU policymakers for more manufacturing support
summary_80w: Two of the major European solar trade associations, the European Solar Manufacturing Council (ESMC) and SolarPower Europe (SPE), have called for EU policymakers to take measures supporting European solar manufacturing.

headline: Chinese BESS players still hope to supply US in FEOC policy environment
summary_80w: Chinese energy storage companies active in the US face an uncertain future as federal policies encourage moves to reduce their supply chain involvement.

headline: Sunotec launches Nordic unit to drive solar and hybrid projects
summary_80w: Sunotec has launched Sunotec Nordic to spearhead solar and hybrid renewable project development across the Nordic region.

headline: Saudi Arabia launches tender for 5.3GW of renewables, 3.1GW of solar
summary_80w: The SPPC has launched a request for qualifications for 5.3GW of new renewable power capacity, of which solar will account for 3.1GW.

headline: GCL Tech secures $700 Million investment from Middle Eastern capital
summary_80w: Chinese polysilicon producer GCL-Tech has entered into a strategic financing agreement with Infini Capital, a globally renowned investment institution backed by a Middle Eastern sovereign wealth fund.

headline: IB Solar to build 4GW TOPCon cell and module plant in India
summary_80w: IB Solar is investing INR30 billion (US$340 million) in a 4GW TOPCon solar cell and module manufacturing plant in Jewar, Uttar Pradesh.

headline: Philippines commissions country’s first agriPV-plus-storage project
summary_80w: The Philippines has commissioned the Batangas 1 project, the country's first to combine agriPV with a battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: Wisconsin Republicans propose bill to improve access to community solar projects
summary_80w: Two Wisconsin Republicans have introduced legislation to open access to community solar projects in the US state.

headline: Turbo Energy secures 336MWh C&I battery storage order in Spain
summary_80w: Residential and C&I energy storage provider Turbo Energy has secured a major order from an unnamed industrial group in the construction industry in Spain.

headline: Explosion test ‘demonstrates effectiveness’ of BESS safety control system, Wärtsilä says
summary_80w: A proprietary explosion control system performed effectively in three recent safety tests conducted on Wärtsilä battery storage equipment.

headline: Ignitis orders 582MWh from Rolls-Royce, Olana takes FID on Lithuania BESS projects
summary_80w: Ignitis Group and Olana Energy have progressed BESS projects in Lithuania closer to construction, with the order of equipment and final investment decision (FID) taken, respectively.

headline: ‘Power even without the sun’: President Marcos Jr inaugurates first ‘solar baseload’ power plant in Philippines
summary_80w: President of the Philippines, Ferdinand Marcos Jr., was in attendance as the country’s first 'baseload' power plant to combine solar PV and battery storage officially went into action.

headline: Fixing the renewable energy data mess
summary_80w: Advances in edge-based artificial intelligence are helping make solar and storage interoperable by tackling the data challenge, writes Andrew Foster.

headline: Italy receives 10GW of solar PV bids in FER X auction, opens second auction
summary_80w: Italy’s latest renewable energy tender has received 12GW of bids, of which the majority, 10GW, came from solar PV.

headline: Sunrun raises US$510 million in securitisation
summary_80w: Sunrun has priced a securitisation of leases and power purchase agreements, taking its non-recourse debt capital raised in Q3 above US$1.5 billion.

headline: Statkraft to sell 1.5GW Indian renewables portfolio to Serentica
summary_80w: Norwegian energy firm Statkraft has agreed to divest a portion of its renewable energy portfolio to Serentica Renewables.

headline: Australian start-up wins funding to commercialise daylight solar inspection technology
summary_80w: UNSW spin-out company Lab360 Solar has been awarded funding from ARENA to bring its drone-based PV inspection technology to market.

headline: UK charts path to trebling solar by 2030
summary_80w: The UK government and solar industry have jointly published a long-anticipated roadmap detailing how to maximise the country’s solar potential. Chris Hewett, CEO of Solar Energy UK takes a closer look at the details.

headline: Australia: installed rooftop solar reaches 26.8GW in H1 2025
summary_80w: Australia has reached 26.8GW of installed rooftop solar at the end of the first half of 2025, according to a report from the Clean Energy Council (CIC).

headline: Vikram Solar, AB Energia ink 200MW TOPCon module supply deal
summary_80w: Vikram Solar has secured a contract to supply 200MW of modules to AB Energia, a domestic solar engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) solutions provider.

headline: Axpo, energieUri and Fluence building 58.6MW of Swiss BESS
summary_80w: Utility and power firms Axpo and energieUri will together deploy two BESS projects in Switzerland with technology provided by system integrator Fluence.

headline: 12.5GWh of grid-scale BESS commissioned in August, including largest single-phase LFP project ever
summary_80w: China again dominated global battery storage deployments in August, accounting for two-thirds of what came online, but Europe, North America and Oceania/Australia had good months too.

headline: Hithium, Fotowatio Renewable Ventures partner for first time with 500MWh grid-forming BESS in Australia
summary_80w: Hithium will supply battery storage and SMA the power conversion systems for a 500MWh grid-forming project in Australia for Fotowatio Renewable Ventures (FRV).

headline: ACME secures US$43 million financing for 400MW project in Rajasthan
summary_80w: ACME Venus Urja has secured INR3.8 billion (US$43 million) to develop and construct a solar-plus-storage project in Barmer, Rajasthan.

headline: Celsia seeks US$1.2 billion investment for 1.2GW solar and wind portfolio
summary_80w: Colombian energy supplier Celsia is seeking more than US$1.2 billion in investment to build wind and solar generation projects in Peru.

headline: BSW-Solar calls for simplified grid access for German solar and storage projects
summary_80w: German trade association BSW-Solar has called the German government for a simplified, standardised and more digitalised grid access for solar PV and energy storage operators.

headline: Risk aversion and market pressures: inside Georgia Power’s latest IRP
summary_80w: Vote Solar's Sean Garren tells PV Tech Premium that Georgia Power's latest IRP is 'skewed so heavily towards fossil fuels'.

headline: NY local town officials call on moratorium to suspend 1GWh BESS, State representatives issue support for project
summary_80w: The Town of Ulster in New York has received a request from local officials of the neighbouring town of Hurley to temporarily suspend the permitting process of a 250MW/1,000MWh BESS project under development by independent power producer (IPP) Terra-Gen.

headline: From stability to volatility: rethinking  performance management in today’s changing electricity markets
summary_80w: As hybridisation and changing grid and market conditions redefine the scope of asset performance management, renewables project services provider E3's Anouk Hut looks at the growing importance of physics-based modelling and integrated digital infrastructure.

headline: Return, N2OFF embark on Germany BESS projects
summary_80w: Dutch BESS operator Return has acquired four ready-to-build (RTB) projects in Germany, while agrifood tech and renewables investor N2OFF has added BESS to a solar project it is developing there.

headline: US cell producer presses on with expansion plans despite policy uncertainty
summary_80w: US cell manufacturer ES Foundry is proceeding with expansion plans despite a six-month delay due to recent trade and tax credit policy uncertainties.

headline: How US solar manufacturing is weathering the policy storm
summary_80w: PV CellTech USA: US cell manufacturer ES Foundry’s CEO Alex Zhu discusses his company's rapid ascent, strategic technology choices and the challenges of operating in a shifting policy environment.

headline: Founder Group secures EPC contract for 30MW Malaysian solar plant
summary_80w: Founder Group has won a RM10 million (US$2.3 million) engineering, procurement, construction and commissioning contract for a 30MW solar plant in Malaysia.

headline: Ib vogt inks 70MW solar vPPA in Romania
summary_80w: German renewable energy developer ib vogt has signed a 70MW solar PV virtual power purchase agreement (vPPA) in Romania.

headline: Madison Energy secures US$800 million to expand US clean energy portfolio
summary_80w: Madison Energy Infrastructure has raised US$800 million to accelerate the deployment of clean energy assets across the US.

headline: European PEARL project develops flexible perovskite cell with 21.6% conversion efficiency
summary_80w: The PEARL Consortium has developed perovskite solar cells with carbon electrodes with a conversion efficiency of 21.6%.

headline: Renewable energy among targets of US$634m EBRD climate finance package
summary_80w: The EBRD has launched a new programme to improve access to green financing and support energy investments such as renewable power projects.

headline: Constant Energy secures US$9.4 million for renewable energy expansion
summary_80w: Constant Energy has secured THB300 million (US$9.4 million) in green financing from HSBC to expand large-scale solar and battery storage projects in Thailand.

headline: Italy: ‘Right now, it doesn’t make sense to invest in co-located storage’
summary_80w: The absence of negative pricing in Italy undermines the case for co-located solar storage, the co-founder of Italian IPP Terrawatt has said.

headline: Solar growth in Central European countries outstrips EU average as coal declines
summary_80w: Solar power generation in Central Europe has grown at more than twice the EU average rate since 2019, according to new figures.

headline: Hithium, Storion announce non-lithium BESS advances in US
summary_80w: Hithium has announced its lithium-ion and sodium-ion battery energy storage system (BESS) for supporting data centres, while Storion Energy has secured its first vanadium electrolyte customer.

headline: Primergy, Gridstor, Sunraycer and Plus Power progress large-scale US BESS projects
summary_80w: A flurry of large-scale BESS project news in the US from four major developer-operators, coinciding with the country's largest clean energy trade show RE+.

headline: Grenergy secures US$270 million financing for 3.5GWh BESS in Oasis de Atacama Phase 6
summary_80w: Grenergy has secured a senior non-recourse financing agreement worth US$270 million for Phase 6 of its flagship Chilean solar-plus-storage project, Oasis de Atacama.

headline: ‘The bar is going up and up’: Sodium-ion firm Natron Energy’s closure highlights alternative chemistry challenges
summary_80w: US sodium-ion battery firm Natron Energy has ceased trading, putting an end to its two domestic gigafactories. The news points to the challenges for battery chemistries hoping to compete with LFP, analysts told Energy-Storage.news.

headline: Still too early to see Trump tariffs’ impact on BESS industry finances
summary_80w: It's still to early to see the financial impact on energy storage suppliers in the wake of Trump's tariffs and legislation, writes Solar Media analyst Charlotte Gisbourne, analysing their H1 revenues.

headline: ‘Storage as fundamental as generation’: DTEK and Fluence turn on 200MW Ukraine BESS
summary_80w: IPP DTEK Group and system integrator Fluence have together put a 200MW/400MWh BESS portfolio in Ukraine into commercial operation, a milestone praised by the country's energy minister Svitlana Grinchuk.

headline: Navigating Italy’s PV project development maze
summary_80w: PV Talk: Italy’s new CfD policy offers clear support for solar developers in an otherwise uncertain legislative landscape, says Terrawatt's Patrizio Donati.

headline: RE+ product launches: Canadian Solar low-carbon modules, FTC Solar new tracker, NovaSource’s AI-platform
summary_80w: At RE+ 2025, companies launched AI-driven platforms, terrain-following trackers, low-carbon modules, and advanced energy management solutions for solar and storage.

headline: Vattenfall commissions 76MW agriPV plant in Germany
summary_80w: A project claimed to be Germany’s largest agriPV plant has been commissioned in the north-east of the country.

headline: rPlus Energies secures US$100 million to build 125MW PV plant in Idaho
summary_80w: Renewables developer rPlus Energies has secured US$100 million in tax equity financing for its 125MW solar PV plant in the US state of Idaho.

headline: Vikram Solar reports 79.7% year-on-year revenue growth in Q1 FY26
summary_80w: Indian solar module manufacturer Vikram Solar reported a 79.7% year-on-year increase in revenue for the first quarter of FY26.

headline: Cordelio Power starts operations at Missouri solar project, uses modules built in the US by Qcells
summary_80w: Cordelio Power has started commercial operations at its 150MW Winfield solar project in Lincoln County, Missouri.

headline: Curtailment of Voltalia’s Brazil fleet reaches 14%
summary_80w: Voltalia is seeking compensation for the ongoing curtailment of its Brazilian solar and wind fleet, which has exceeded expectations this year.

headline: Toyo Solar ships 1.6GW PV cells in H1 2025 amid shift to US market
summary_80w: Japanese solar cell manufacturer Toyo Solar has sold 1.6GW of solar PV cells in the first half of 2025, driving revenue of around US$139 million.

headline: Australia: Coordinated approach to transmission in Pilbara could save AU$30 billion
summary_80w: The CEFC has said that a coordinated approach to transmission in Pilbara, Western Australia, could save more than AU$30 billion over 25 years.

headline: ‘Made in America’ and energy density race lead  battery storage discussions at RE+ 2025
summary_80w: Two energy storage topics appeared to come up in conversation more than any other at the first day of RE+: US domestic content and the race for energy density increases.

headline: ‘A key technology’: Google to help fund non-lithium LDES projects in Arizona with SRP
summary_80w: Tech giant Google has announced a partnership with utility SRP to help accelerate the commercialisation of non-lithium long-duration energy storage (LDES) technology.

headline: NextEra and California utility agree BESS offtake deal with protections against future Federal actions and market volatility
summary_80w: California community choice aggregator (CCA) Orange County Power Authority (OCPA) and independent power producer NextEra Energy Resources (NEER) have agreed on the terms of a flexible offtake agreement relating to a 115MW/460MWh standalone BESS.

summary_80w: Fidra Energy has secured £1 billion for the largest BESS in the UK, while EDF and Elements Green have agreed a toll for a 720MWh system.

headline: BESS route-to-market deals between Greenvolt and Entrix in Poland, Zelestra and BKW in Italy
summary_80w: Major BESS route-to-market (RTM) deals have been announced in Poland, by Greenvolt and Entrix, and in Italy, by Zelestra and BKW.

headline: Tesla expects to have 4.5GW of grid-forming BESS operating in Australia by the end of 2026
summary_80w: Tesla has announced that by the end of 2026, it expects to have around 4.5GW of grid-forming battery storage operating across Australia.

headline: Iberdrola signs 77MW PPA with Italian retailer Selex
summary_80w: Iberdrola has signed a 77MW power purchase agreement (PPA) with Italian grocery retail group Selex Gruppo Commerciale.

headline: Tesla launches integrated 20MWh Megapack BESS solution
summary_80w: Tesla announced its new integrated 20MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) solution, the Tesla Megablock, on 8 September in Las Vegas, US.

headline: US energy storage industry ‘has to continue to be aggressive’
summary_80w: “The industry has to continue to be aggressive,” says Luigi Resta, president of US renewable energy and energy storage developer rPlus Energies, on the US remaining a competitive market for energy storage.

headline: Flatiron Energy proposes 672MWh BESS at former Massachusetts fossil plant, pauses indoor BESS project in Boston
summary_80w: Flatiron Energy has commenced initial proceedings to construct a 168MW/672MWh BESS at the site of a former coal-fired power plant located in Bristol County, Massachusetts.

headline: Lithium-ion is long-duration energy storage (LDES)
summary_80w: Emerging tech must prove it can outcompete the incumbent, writes Sightline Climate analyst Lukas Karapin-Springorum, outlining the state of play in LDES technology today.

headline: Hithium and BOS Power sign 3GWh BESS agreement for Nordics
summary_80w: Chinese lithium-ion OEM Hithium and system integrator BOS Power have signed a supply agreement for 3GWh of BESS deployments in the Nordic region.

headline: Australia: ‘Social licensing is the next frontier for battery energy storage systems’
summary_80w: “Social licensing is the next frontier for battery energy storage systems,” said Matt Baumgurtel, partner, new energy lead at Hamilton Locke.

headline: ‘Optimising BESS performance requires long-term perspective,’ says Fluence
summary_80w: Andrés Barberán, energy storage product manager at Fluence, emphasises that optimising battery energy storage system (BESS) performance means making decisions with the entire asset lifecycle in mind, not just immediate returns.

headline: US energy storage market ‘getting used to policy uncertainty’
summary_80w: The US energy storage industry is becoming better equipped to handle the policy uncertainty which has characterised the year so far, Energy-Storage.news has heard.

headline: California set to cut funding for load-reducing distributed storage programme
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Ryan Hledik, Principal at the Brattle Group, and Lauren Nevitt, Senior Director of Public Policy at Sunrun, on the shaky future of California’s Demand Side Grid Support distributed storage programme.

headline: 12GWh PHES and 1.2GWh BESS added to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: A 12GWh pumped hydro project and a 1,200MWh battery energy storage system in New South Wales (NSW) have been submitted to Australia’s Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act.

headline: RE+ 2025: Product launches, showcases and news ahead of the biggest clean energy trade show in the US
summary_80w: With RE+ bringing thousands of energy storage professionals to Las Vegas this week, here are some announcements that have hit the Energy-Storage.news desk.

headline: Sungrow deploys first C&I community batteries to undergo CSIP-AUS testing in South Australia
summary_80w: Chinese solar PV inverter and energy storage provider Sungrow has deployed two C&I community batteries, marking the first in South Australia to undergo Common Smart Inverter Profile for Australia (CSIP-AUS) testing.

headline: Neoen Australia energises Western Downs BESS Stage 2 six weeks ahead of schedule
summary_80w: Neoen Australia has announced the successful energisation of the second stage of its 540MWh Western Downs battery energy storage system (BESS) in Queensland, completing the milestone six weeks ahead of schedule.

headline: US policy-driven turbulence ‘changes but doesn’t eliminate the opportunity’ for battery storage
summary_80w: ESN Premium speaks with Chris McKissack, CEO of developer Fullmark Energy, on issues affecting the US market today and the company’s transition from its legacy business model.

headline: SK On signs 7.2GWh deal to supply US-made LFP batteries to Flatiron Energy Development
summary_80w: South Korean company SK On has entered the US BESS market with LFP batteries, securing a supply contract with Flatiron Energy Development.

headline: VIDEO: Model and maximise C&I battery storage profits with Qcells + Geli
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with Qcells + Geli, on modelling and realising maximum profits from commercial & industrial (C&I) battery storage systems.

headline: SOC errors in LFP batteries are draining revenue – here’s how to fix it
summary_80w: Last summer, a Texas energy storage operator watched in frustration as their battery system missed a golden trading opportunity during a peak demand window.
